data.title: Revco to acquire Hook
data.meta_description: Revco D.S. Inc. announced Monday it has entered into a definitive merger agreement to acquire all outstanding Hook-SupeRx (HSI) shares for $13.75 per share,...
data.text:
TWINSBURG, Ohio, April 4 -- Revco D.S. Inc. announced Monday it has entered into a definitive merger agreement to acquire all outstanding Hook-SupeRx (HSI) shares for $13.75 per share, for a total acquisition value of approximately $600 million.

The Twinsburg-headquartered Revco said stockholders of HSI, owning approximately 49 percent of the outstanding HSI shares, have agreed to vote in favor of the transaction.

HSI, a retail drug store chain headquartered in Cincinnati, has nearly 1,200 stores and had sales of $2.3 billion during the past year. months. HSI stores operate variously under the names Hook's, SupeRx and Brooks.

Revco and HSI combined, operate 2,371 stores and achieved sales of $4.7 billion duringr the past twelve months. The acquisition will make Revco the second largest drugstore chain in the nation.

'HSI is an excellent fit for Revco, and we look forward to welcoming their employees and customers,' said D. Dwayne Hoven, president of Revco. 'This strategic acquisition enhances our position in the market, strengthens our capabilities in third-party marketing, and helps further position us for health care reform. It will also provide an expanded mail-order business and enhanced benefits-management capabilities.

'Revco's strategy has been to increase market penetration by adding stores in the nine contiguous states in which we operate,' Hoven said. 'The 22-state geographic area in which HSI operates will strengthen our position in Ohio, Pennsylvania, Maryland, West Virginia, Virginia and Tennessee.'

The transaction is expected to be completed during the early summer.
